Returns:
the euclidean distance computed on the difference between a and b as a double

bezdekPartitionCoefficient

public static double bezdekPartitionCoefficient(float[][] U)
Computes the partition coefficient as proposed by Bezdek in "Bezdek JC. Cluster validity with fuzzy sets. J Cybern 1974;3:58–73" It considers the average sum of the squared fuzzy membership values Better clustering partitions induce higher values of the coefficient

Parameters:
U - The float matrix containing the fuzzy memberships, result of the fuzzy clustering algorithm
Returns:
the computed partition coefficient as a double

compactnessAndSeparationMetric

public static double compactnessAndSeparationMetric(float[][] X,
                                                    float[][] U,
                                                    float[][] V,
                                                    double m)
Computes the compactness and separation metric as proposed by Xie and Ben in Xie XL, Beni GA. Validity measure for fuzzy clustering. IEEE Trans Pattern Anal Mach Intell 1991;3:841–6. The numerator determines the objective function J and represents a form of intracluster distance wherease the denominator computes the intercluster distance considering the minimum distance between the cluster centroids. The optimal clustering is achieved when the metric is minimized.

Parameters:
X - the data matrix
U - the cluster fuzzy membership matrix
V - the cluster centroid matrix
m - the fuzzyness parameter
Returns:
the computed metric as a double

partitionEntropyIndex

public static double partitionEntropyIndex(float[][] U)
Computes the partition entropy Index as a mean of esteeming cluster validity as proposed in Bezdek JC. Mathematical models for systematic and taxonomy. In: proceedings of eigth international conference on numerical taxonomy,San Francisco; 1975, p. 143–66. It computes the entropy based on the cluster membership values. Minimizing it will produce better clustering partitions.

Parameters:
U - the cluster fuzzy membership matrix
Returns:
the computed index as a double

dunnIndex

public static double dunnIndex(float[][] X,
                               float[][] U,
                               float[][] V)
